meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Time to get groovy with some puzzle-solving fun!

I'm diving into the world of Humanity, a game that's got everyone talking. With a plethora of glowing reviews from esteemed critics like IGN, GameSpot, and more, I'm excited to see what all the fuss is about.

As a seasoned (get it? Seasoned? Like me?) reviewer, I'll be focusing on the gameplay itself, without getting too caught up in the artistic or narrative aspects. After all, what's the point of solving puzzles if they're not fun?

First off, let's get this out of the way: Humanity is a blast. It's one of those games that has you hooked from the very beginning, with its addictive clicky-beat soundtrack and visually stunning (yet minimalist) graphics.

Now, onto the gameplay itself! You play as an army of cute, little critters trying to make their way through a series of increasingly complex puzzles. Sounds simple enough, right? Wrong!

As you progress, you'll encounter all sorts of obstacles, from environmental hazards to pesky enemies and even your own fellow critters trying to sabotage your efforts.

What's great about Humanity is that it strikes the perfect balance between challenging and accessible. You're never left feeling like you're stuck or frustrated for too long, but you're also constantly encouraged to think outside the box (or in this case, the puzzle grid).

One thing I do appreciate about the game is its commitment to exploration and creativity. As you progress through the levels, new mechanics are introduced, giving you more tools at your disposal to solve those pesky puzzles.

Now, let's take a peek at what some of our esteemed critic friends have to say:

* IGN calls Humanity "a beautiful, modern reimagining" of Lemmings, praising its artsy vibe and ambition.
* GameSpot describes it as a charming, engaging puzzle adventure with constantly-evolving gameplay.
* Game Informer praises the game's balance between challenge and accessibility, likening it to solving complex computer code.

So, is Humanity worth your time? Absolutely! It's a delightful puzzle game that will keep you hooked for hours on end. And who knows? You might even learn something about what it means to be human along the way...
